intro: Aulonemia lanciflora, commonly known as the narrow-leaved aulonemia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Arecaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia and is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, clustered inflorescences with yellowish-green flowers that bloom during the wet season. Aulonemia lanciflora typically grows in swampy or wetland habitats, where it thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soils. Its ecological importance includes providing habitat and food for various insect and bird species.
